Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky brown; traces of two added white bands above part of lotus flower in white outline with added red centre; exterior: around rim (top lost), hook maeander band above two lines; below, painted decoration consisting of undetermined motif; part of pendant triangle as filling ornament; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The added white bands above the lotus on the interior surface are unusual. The usual reserved band at the top of the rim has not been preserved.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0436) (phase 2)
